description:
Google's line of products and services to clients never stops growing. Strategic Partner Managers have the rare opportunity to build a long-lasting relationship with our top partners. You cultivate these existing partnerships to make sure they can take full advantage of Google's ever-growing suite of offerings. You possess strong relationship-building skills and are apt to see mutually beneficial opportunities with partners in order to best represent our users, products and programs.

Strategy and Operations team supports the Hardware Partnerships organization by providing strategic guidance and scaled support needed to enable the growth of our business. As an Events Program Manager, you will play a critical role in defining and driving strategic events and communication initiatives. You are a proven expert in delivering high-quality events spanning in size from 5-300 attendees. You know the critical importance of planning, yet also embrace flexibility and can think on your feet. You will be an exceptional team member, experienced event specialist, and have stellar organizational skills. You are passionate about helping others, love getting the details right, thrive with independence, enjoy working across teams, and are proactive when you spot an opportunity.

The Hardware Partnerships team was formed with the purpose of bringing the best of Google’s software and hardware to our users by bringing to market and distributing a Google-branded hardware portfolio. The team is responsible for managing all partnerships with carriers, retailers and resellers worldwide. This includes the partnerships for products such as Pixel, Daydream View, Google Wifi, Google Nest Thermostat, Chromecast Ultra and Google Home.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience helping produce events, specifically those with a focus on sales and advertising.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Excellent problem-solving and project management skills
  • Extremely detail-oriented with exceptional organizational skills.
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills; ability to be personable yet persistent. This position requires leading and working effectively with cross functional groups.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to simultaneously manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines, positive attitude.
  • Demonstrated ability to work calmly and maintain good judgment in fast-paced, high-stress environment.
  • Must be flexible and willing to travel as needed.
responsibilities:
• Support the Global Hardware Partnerships team via unique events and programs on campus and at external-facing events worldwide.
  • Program manage internal and external events, including but not limited to creating and managing run of show, preparing and updating events decks and partnering closely with admin team in order to coordinate critical events logistics.
  • Assist with post-event analysis including surveys, recaps, and recommendations for improvement.
  • Manage all correspondence and maintain strong relationships with venues, vendors, agencies and key internal stakeholders.
title: Events Program Manager, Strategy and Operations, Hardware Partnerships
